body.p: Several body fluids work in conjunction with organs to create physical barriers to pathogens. Which of the following groups comprises fluids that all fit this description?

multiple_choice.choice: Tears, stomach acid, urine and serum
Stomach acid, mucus, tears and tissue fluid

feedback.p: Incorrect. While urine helps to keep the urethra flushed out, it does not specifically impede pathogens.
Correct. All of these body fluids help to trap or prevent pathogens from entering the body.
Incorrect. Urine and serum are not helpful in this regard.
Incorrect. Tissue fluid does not provide any kind of barrier activity.
